title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHICAGO — On a night destined for the history books, the San Antonio Spurs were not merely defeated; they were the canvas for Michael Jordan’s masterpiece.

The Chicago Bulls delivered a breathtaking 111-69 annihilation of the Spurs, but the final score was a mere footnote. This was the Michael Jordan Show, a virtuoso performance where His Airness dropped a casual 40 points in just three quarters of work.

From the opening tip, Jordan was a predator. He carved through the Spurs’ defense with an unnerving ease, his mid-range jumper a metronome of destruction. The 40 points were not a product of a frantic, late-game surge; they were a systematic dismantling. With each silky fadeaway and explosive drive, the Bulls’ lead swelled, and the aura of inevitability consumed the Chicago Stadium. By the time he took a seat for the final quarter, his work was unequivocally complete.

While Jordan’s scoring was the headline, his all-around dominance fueled the blowout. He filled the stat sheet with 8 rebounds, 5 assists, 3 steals, and a block, a line that underscored his complete command of the game. Scottie Pippen provided the perfect complement, adding 16 points, but this night was a solo flight.

The Spurs, led by 19 points from Vinny Del Negro, had no answers. They were simply witnesses to a force of nature. The 42-point margin of victory was staggering, but it was the singular, spectacular effort from number 23 that made it historic.

In a season filled with championships and accolades, this was a stark reminder: when Michael Jordan decided to take over, the outcome was never in doubt, and the performance was never forgotten.
